skill.author: CloudAI-X

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill with no executable code. It provides instructional guidance on using Claude Code's built-in Task tool for parallel execution patterns. No scripts, network calls, file system access, or code execution capabilities are present.

content.user_title: Run multiple AI subagents in parallel
content.value_statement: Sequential task execution wastes time when independent tasks could run simultaneously. This skill teaches patterns for spawning multiple AI subagents concurrently using the Task tool, enabling dramatic speedups for multi-part projects.
actual_capabilities: Spawn multiple subagents simultaneously using Task tool with run_in_background
Identify independent tasks suitable for parallel execution
Retrieve results from parallel tasks using TaskOutput
Synthesize results from multiple subagents into unified output
Apply directory-based and perspective-based parallelization patterns
limitations: All Task calls must be in a single assistant message for true parallelism
Tasks must be independent with no dependencies on each other
Cannot parallelize tasks that modify the same files
Does not work for sequential workflows requiring ordered steps

use_cases.title: Implement feature modules
use_cases.description: Build multiple independent features simultaneously, like auth, API endpoints, and database schema

use_cases.title: Multi-perspective analysis
use_cases.description: Run security, performance, testing, and architecture reviews concurrently

use_cases.title: Parallel verification
use_cases.description: Execute multiple independent checks and tests at the same time for faster feedback

prompt_templates.title: Basic parallel launch
prompt_templates.prompt:
I need to analyze this codebase from two perspectives. Launch both analyses in parallel using the Task tool with run_in_background: true.

Task 1: Analyze the security implementation
Task 2: Analyze the performance patterns

Then retrieve both results and summarize findings.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-module implementation
prompt_templates.prompt:
Implement three independent features for my project. Launch all three as parallel subagents:

- Subagent 1: User authentication module
- Subagent 2: API endpoints for user data
- Subagent 3: Database schema for users

Make all Task calls in one message. After completion, combine into cohesive implementation.

prompt_templates.title: Directory-based parallel
prompt_templates.prompt:
Analyze three directories in parallel: src/auth, src/api, src/db.

For each, review: code quality, security issues, test coverage.
Launch three subagents simultaneously. Synthesize findings by severity.

prompt_templates.title: Perspective review
prompt_templates.prompt:
Perform a comprehensive code review using four parallel subagents:

- Security reviewer: Check for vulnerabilities
- Performance reviewer: Identify bottlenecks
- Testing reviewer: Evaluate test coverage
- Architecture reviewer: Assess design patterns

All in one message. Combine recommendations with priority ordering.

output_examples.input: Analyze the frontend, backend, and database layers of my project in parallel. Then create a unified summary.
output: Frontend Analysis: 3 files reviewed. Found 2 component issues, 1 performance concern. Recommendation: Implement memoization.
Backend Analysis: 5 files reviewed. Found 1 security issue, 2 API improvements needed. Recommendation: Add input validation.
Database Analysis: 2 files reviewed. Schema is well-designed. Minor optimization suggested for index usage.
Combined Summary: 4 high-priority items, 3 medium-priority items. Focus on security fix first, then performance optimizations.

best_practices: Launch all parallel tasks in a single assistant message to ensure true concurrency
Verify tasks are independent before parallelizing - check for file and output dependencies
Use descriptive task descriptions to easily track which subagent handles what
Mark parallel tasks as in_progress in TodoWrite before launch, then mark completed after TaskOutput
anti_patterns: Splitting Task calls across multiple messages (causes sequential execution)
Parallelizing tasks that depend on each other's output
Running multiple tasks that modify the same files (causes conflicts)
Not waiting for all TaskOutput results before synthesizing

faq.question: What AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude Code and Claude (Chat). Not available on Codex. Requires Task tool with run_in_background support.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of parallel tasks?
faq.answer: The limit depends on your Claude Code plan. Generally 5-10 parallel tasks work well. Test with your specific configuration.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other skills?
faq.answer: Use TodoWrite to track parallel tasks. After TaskOutput retrieval, update todos and pass results to other skills like orchestrator.

faq.question: Is my data safe with parallel execution?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens within your Claude Code session. No data is sent to external services beyond normal AI model calls.

faq.question: Why are my tasks running sequentially instead of in parallel?
faq.answer: Common cause: Task calls are in separate messages. All Task calls MUST be in one assistant message for true parallelism.

faq.question: How does this compare to sequential execution?
faq.answer: Parallel execution can be Nx faster where N is task count. Five 30-second tasks complete in ~30 seconds instead of ~150 seconds sequentially.
